properties.Name: Central Children's Library
properties.Details: Explore a wide choice of stories, old and new, together with lots of picture books for younger readers. Not forgetting our DVDs. We also have excellent books to help with school projects and hobbies. Join in with our storytimes and rhymetimes, and keep an eye out for our other children’s events held throughout the year.

properties.Name: Central Lending Library
properties.News:
We’ve discovered a structural problem with an area of central library that is not open to the public.
We’ve closed this area to staff while checks are carried out. Until these checks are complete, and remedial work carried out staff cannot fetch any of the classic fiction and non fiction works which are normally stored in this area. This also includes some of our audio books. 
We’re sorry for any inconvenience caused. Please speak to staff to see if alternatives can be arranged.
properties.Details: High interest rates guaranteed with a great and varied collection of all the latest titles plus old favourites.    Choose from a wide range of fact and fiction including collections of travel books, language courses, maps and DVDs. Our friendly staff are always on hand to help and advise you with selection.   Don't forget to look out for our topical displays and themed events.

properties.Name: Corstorphine Library
properties.Temporary closure:
Corstorphine Library – Health & Safety Upgrade works
12th - 15th March 2015: Temporary Closure

Corstorphine Library will close for approximately 3 days from 8pm on Wednesday 11th March.  This will enable the first phase of a planned programme of Fire Safety upgrade works to be carried out.  It is anticipated that, subject to successful completion, the library will re-open on Monday 16th.

Scheduled events of Crafty Friday and Bookbug on the Saturday, will take place at the Corstorphine Youth & Community Centre (Lucy’s Cafe) on St. John’s Road at their normal scheduled times. All other enquires should be redirected to the Drumbrae Library Hub whilst the building is closed.

Apologies for any inconvenience this may cause while these much needed works take place.  If you require any more information please get in touch.

properties.Name: Edinburgh and Scottish Collection
properties.News:
We’ve discovered a structural problem with an area of central library that is not open to the public.
We’ve closed this area to staff while checks are carried out. Until these checks are complete and remedial work carried out staff cannot fetch any of the books or other material stored in this space. This includes most of our material relating to Edinburgh, including Valuation Rolls and Electoral Registers, as well as our older Scottish material. 
We’re sorry for any inconvenience caused. Please speak to staff to see if alternatives can be arranged.
properties.Details: The place to find out about Scotland and its capital. Fantastic heritage collections cover history, maps, literature, local and family history as well as up to date information about your local area.

properties.Learning and Information Point: Displays featuring information on ‘Environment and Conservation’, ‘Learning,’ ‘Volunteering’, ‘What’s On Locally’, ‘Advice for Older People, ‘Housing’, and ‘Business & Development’
properties.Bookbug Sessions:
A free event for 0 to 4 year olds and their parents/carers, Fridays from 10.30 to 11.15am.
Polish Bookbug sessions are on Mondays from 10.30 - 11.15am
properties.English Classes: ESOL Classes are available from Edinburgh college. They take place in our library every Wednesday and Thursday. If you wish to book a place on these  courses you need to contact Duncan Place. Tel: 0131 535 4630 Email: caroline.battes@edinburghcollege.ac.uk We have ESOL Crisis English classes from 1pm to 3pm on Thursdays, you are welcome to turn up on the day without appointment.
properties.Book groups:
Join Anna for her book group of fantastic fiction last Monday of every month at 6.30-7.30pm. Contact the library as there may be a waiting list. 

The 'Found in Translation' group for contemporary European literature translated into English meets every 3rd Monday of the month at 6pm - contact the library to put your name down.

We also run an ESOL reading group: 'Chatabout' on the last Thursday of the month from 10.30 - 11.30am. Contact wendy.pearson@edinburgh.gov.uk or call 0131 242 8022 for details

Our independent book group with Chris and friends, new members are welcome. Please get in touch via email: edinburghbookgroup@gmail.com
properties.Other events:
Gaming for our Teenagers every Monday 5.30pm, all teens are welcome to join, just turn up on the night.

Craft for children (Fridays 3-4pm, drop in)

Councillors' surgeries

Learn IT beginners' computer classes
properties.Business Workshops: McDonald Road Library is a Business Hub which provides support and advice for starting or growing your business. Professional workshops are run by the Business Gateway at the Hub and you can also access a fantastic range of databases and up-to-date business books. Check the Business Gateway site for details of workshops taking place in the library

properties.Name: Music Library
properties.News:
We’ve discovered a structural problem with an area of central library that is not open to the public.
We’ve closed this area to staff while checks are carried out. Until these checks are complete and remedial work carried out staff cannot fetch music scores, older CDs and DVDs or other material stored in this space.
We’re sorry for any inconvenience caused. Please speak to staff to see if alternatives can be arranged.
properties.Details:
The Music Library contains the largest collection of publicly accessible material on music and dance in Scotland. Whether you need help identifying a piece of music or want to take up the saxaphone, expert staff are on hand to help.
We also offer music streaming, a soundproof pod, Sibelius composition software and a digital piano.

properties.Name: Newington Library (currently closed)
properties.Temporary closure:
Newington Library is currently closed while we update our heating, lighting, and electrical systems, giving the library comfort cooling and control over the heating levels. 

A mobile library will be available outside Mayfield Salisbury Parish Church on West Mayfield at the following times:
Monday 10:30-6:30, Thursday 10:30-3:30, Saturday 10:30-3:30

We will continue to run all of our regular activities at the following times and locations:

Children’s activities – all at Mayfield Salisbury Parish Church:

Baby Rhymetime: Mondays at 11am
Rhymetime: Wednesdays at 11am & 2pm
Craft Session: Fridays at 2:30pm

Adult activities – all at Morningside Library:

Italian Group: fortnightly from Tuesday 6 January 6:45pm 
Book Group: monthly from Tuesday 6 January 6:45pm 
Get Stitched Group: weekly from Wednesday 7 January 6:30pm 
Book Group: monthly from Wednesday 21 January 6:30pm 

Our library link and housebound services will also continue from alternative locations.

We are happy to discuss any suggestions for other activities or services during the closure – speak to a member of staff on the mobile library, or email us.

The library will reopen before Easter 2015.
properties.Telephone: http://While we are closed call Morningside Library on 0131 529 5654
properties.Facebook: Get the latest news on our Facebook page
properties.Bus routes: Lothian 5 (to Grange Road), 42, 67 (to Mayfield Road) 3, 7, 8, 29, 31 and 49 (to Mayfield Gardens)

properties.Name: Reference Library
properties.News:
We’ve discovered a structural problem with an area of central library that is not open to the public.
We’ve closed this area to staff while checks are carried out and remedial work carried out. Until these checks are complete staff cannot fetch any of the books or other material stored in this space. 
We’re sorry for any inconvenience caused. Please speak to staff to see if alternatives can be arranged.
properties.Details: A collection of a third of a million items,  helpful staff, free internet access and the beautiful surroundings of the reading room make the reference library the ideal place for information, research, study or just relaxing in peaceful contemplation. Contact us with your enquiry or visit us to browse the collection and use our study facilities - including free wi-fi.

properties.Bookbug Sessions:
A free event for 0 to 4 year olds and their parents/carers. Every Tuesday at 10.30-11.30am.
Polish Rhymetimes - first Friday of the month at 10.30am.
properties.Book groups:
We have 2 groups for adults:
Book Group: last Thursday of the month, 2-3.30pm.
Monday Night Crime Club: first Monday of the month, 6.30 - 7.30pm.

Chatterbooks: children’s book club for 8-12yrs, fortnightly Wednesdays, 3.45-4.45pm.
LVL-UP: Boys’ Reading/Activity Group for 10-14yrs, every Monday 5.45-7pm.
GlitzLit: Girls’ Reading/Activity Group for 10-14yrs, every Tuesday 6-7pm
properties.Other events:
Library Link: every second Friday, 2-3pm.

MSP's surgery: first Monday of the month, 6:30pm

Knit and natter: every second Wednesday, 2.00 - 4.00pm.

NHS Lothian Stop Smoking group: drop in on Tuesdays from 1.30 - 3.30pm.

Coffee morning: drop in from 10.30 - 11.30am on Wednesdays.

Learn IT classes for beginner computer users  (Contact the Library for details).

Activities in school holidays for children and young people.

Nursery & school visits on request (Contact the Library).
properties.Room hire:
Commercial:
3 hour block: £82.40, then £15 per hour or part.
IT facilities are also available at £5.15 per PC (for first three hours, thereafter £5.00 per PC per hour or part).
Non commercial:
3 hour block: £22, then £5 per hour or part.
IT facilities are also available at £2.06 per PC (for first three hours, thereafter £2.00 per PC per hour or part)
All lets outside opening hours, Monday to Friday, £15 per hour extra. Weekend rates by negotiation.
For partner projects, charges to be identified within project budget.
